from or referring to the period of time between around 208 and 146 million years ago, in which the first birds appeared and the single piece of land broke up into separate continents: The allosaurus was a fearsome predator that lived during the Jurassic Period 150 million years ago. New Mexico's Jurassic formations hint of isolated dinosaur populations.

the Jurassic
the period of time between around 208 and 146 million years ago, in which the first birds appeared and the single piece of land broke up into separate continents: Dinosaurs were far better adapted to life in the Jurassic. The brontosaurs had long necks that enabled them to reach the high-growing conifers prevalent in the Jurassic.
More examplesFewer examples Intriguingly, there is very little evidence of any widespread glaciation 150 million years ago, during the geological period known as the Jurassic.In addition in the Jurassic there were some truly great coelurosaur types with fearsome talons.It suggests that life in the Jurassic and Cretaceous was more New Age than anyone had imagined.
